member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eTorsion
member.summary: Contains the provisions given in Chapter 4 Ultimate Limit States of EBCS-2-1995 concerning flexure.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade
member.summary: Used to specify different types of grade of concrete interms of its characterstic compressive cube strength.
member.remarks: Allowable Grades in Class I and Class II Work are different, therefore there must be FindDesnCompStrength condition to handle this. This enumertion totaly include the domains of both ClassI Works

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.C5
member.summary: Concrete having characterstic compressive cube strength of 5MPa.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.C15
member.summary: Concrete having characterstic compressive cube strength of 15MPa.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.C20
member.summary: Concrete having characterstic compressive cube strength of 20MPa.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.C25
member.summary: Concrete having characterstic compressive cube strength of 25MPa.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.C30
member.summary: Concrete having characterstic compressive cube strength of 30MPa.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.C40
member.summary: Concrete having characterstic compressive cube strength of 40MPa.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.C50
member.summary: Concrete having characterstic compressive cube strength of 50MPa.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.C60
member.summary: Concrete having characterstic compressive cube strength of 60MPa.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade.Custom
member.summary: User defined concrete grade.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eActionCondition
member.summary: Contains the action conditions specified on Table 3.3 of EBCS-2-1995

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eActionCondition.Favourable
member.summary: Favourable action condition

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eActionCondition.Unfavourable
member.summary: Unfavourable action condition

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eSpanType
member.summary: The type of span of beam or slab depending on the type of connection to neighbours.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eSpanType.SimplySupported
member.summary: There is no moment continuity in all direction.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eSpanType.EndSpan
member.summary: There is moment continuity in one direction and no one in the other.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eSpanType.InteriorSpan
member.summary: There is moment continuity in every direction.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eSpanType.Cantilever
member.summary: There is moment continuity in one direction and no connection(free end) in the other.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eMaterialType
member.summary: Set of materials defined in the building code.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eMaterialType.Concrete
member.summary: Is a material made from a mixture of aggregates and cement and moulded into a shape.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eMaterialType.ReinforcingSteel
member.summary: Is the material composed into RC to impart tensile strength capacity for concrete

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eFlexure
member.summary: Contains the provisions given in Chapter 4-Ultimate Limit States of EBCS-2-1995 concerning flexure.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eFlexure.StressApprxFactor
member.summary: A coefficient to estimate the actual parabolic stress distribution with rectangular one.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eFlexure.Get_k_x_max(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the maximum x/d value[Sec. 3.7.9 of EBCS 2, 1995]
member.param: The moment after redistribution. For example 0.9 for 10% redistribution

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eFlexure.Get_k_x_max
member.summary: Gets the maximum x/d value taking the 0% redistribution. [Sec. 3.7.9 of EBCS 2, 1995]

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing
member.summary: Contains the provisions given in Chapter 7 - Detailing Provision of EBCS-2-1995

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetBarsBetwee(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns array of bar diameters between the specified bar diameters
member.param: The smallest bar diameter.
The largest bar diameter.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.Get_ρ_min(ESADS.Code.eStructureType,ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade)
member.summary: Gets the minimum geometrical ratio of reinforcement for flexure.
member.param: The type of structure, defined in eStructureType, under consideration
The steel grade, defined in eSteelGrade, used in the specified structure at the particular position whose minimum reinforcement ratio is to be computed.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.Get_ρ_max
member.summary: Returns the maximum allowable area of steel for beam.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetMinSpacing(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the minimum spacing of longitudinal reinforcements in beam[Sec. 7.1.4.3 of EBCS-2, 1995]
member.param: The maximum size of bar used
The maximum aggregate size of the concrete used

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetMinConcreteCover(ESADS.Code.eExposureType)
member.summary: Returns the minimum concrete cover used for a given exposure type as per [EBCS-1995,EBCS-2,Sec 7.1.3.].
member.param: Type of exposure for the beam.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetDesignBondStrength(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the design bond strength of a bond according to EBCS-2-Section 7.1.5.1
member.param: The design tensile strength of the concrete used.
Indicates if the bar used is deformed or not.
Value indicating if the bond condition is good. Good bond conditions are defined in EBCS-2-1992, Sec. 7.1.5.1(2). Otherwise the value is false.
member.returns: The design bond strength in the same unit as that of the design tensile strength of the concrete given.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetBasicAnchorageLength(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the embedment length required to develop the full design strength of a straight reinforcing bar..[EBCS-2, 1995 Sec.7.1.6.1]
member.param: The diameter of the reinforcement.
The design strength of the reinforcement steel.
The design bond strength in the same unit as f_yd.
member.returns: The basic anchorage length in the same length unit as that of the given bar diameter.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetMinAnchorageLength(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the minimum anchorage lenght. [EBCS-2, 1995 Sec 7.1.6.2]
member.param: The diameter of the renforcement.
The basic anchorage length.
Indicates if the reinforcement is loaded in tension. If the value is false it is implied that the bar is loaded in compression.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetReqAnchorageLength(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,ESADS.Code.eAnchorageType)
member.summary: Gets the required anchorage length a reinforcement. [EBCS-2, 1995 Sec 7.1.6.2]
member.param: The theoretical area of reinforcement required by the design.
The actual area of steel used after the design.
The basic anchorage length.
The minimum anchorage length.
Value indicating if the bar is straight used in compression or tension. If the value is false it is implied that the anchorage is in tension with standard hooks of EBCS-2, 1995, Fig.7.2.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetReqAnchorageLength(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ESADS.Code.eAnchorageType)
member.summary: Gets the required anchorage length a reinforcement from the basic inputs required. [EBCS-2, 1995 Sec 7.1.6.2]
member.param: The theoretical area of reinforcement required by the design.
The actual area of steel used after the design.
The diameter of the reinforcement.
The design strength of the reinforcement steel.
The design tensile strength of the concrete used.
Indicates if the bar used is deformed or not.
Value indicating if the bond condition is good. Good bond conditions are defined in EBCS-2-1992, Sec. 7.1.5.1(2). Otherwise the value is false.
Indicates if the reinforcement is loaded in tension. If the value is false it is implied that the bar is loaded in compression.
Value indicating if the bar is straight used in compression or tension. If the value is false it is implied that the anchorage is in tension with standard hooks of EBCS-2, 1995, Fig.7.2.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetLapLength
member.summary: Gets the length of lap for reinforcement.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetMinLapLength(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the minimum lap length allowed.
member.param: Distance between two adjacent laps.
Distance to the nearest surface.
Percentage of reinforcement lapped within the required lap length.
Value indicating if the bar is straight used in compression or tension. If the value is false it is implied that the anchorage is in tension with standard hooks of EBCS-2, 1995, Fig.7.2.
The basic anchorage length.
The reinforcement diameter.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.Get_a1(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the a1 value for lab length calculation according to Table 7.3 of EBCS-2, 1995
member.param: Distance between two adjacent laps.
Distance to the nearest surface.
Percentage of reinforcement lapped within the required lap length. Value should be between 0 and 100 inclusive.
The diameter of the reinforcement.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetMaxLongtudinalShearBarSpacing(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the maximum shear reinforcement spacing in the longtudinal direction of beam.
member.param: Effective depth of the cross section.
Design shear force at that cross section.
The diagonal compresive strength of the concrete.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetMaxTransversalShearBarSpacing(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the maximum shear reinforcement spacing in transversal direction of beam
member.param: Effective depth of the cross section.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.Get_ρ_min(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the minimum geometrical ratio of reinforcement for shear.
member.param: The characterstic yeild strength of the shear reinforcement.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetHookLength(System.Double)
member.summary: Return the length of standard hook for reinforcemtns.
member.param: diameter of the bar.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eClassWork
member.summary: Concrete works are classification as either Class I or II depending on the quality of workmanship and the competence of the supervisors directing the works.[Sec.1.2.1 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eClassWork.ClassI
member.summary: Works carried out under the direction of appropriately qualified supervisors ensuring the attainment of level of quality control envisaged in Chapter 9 of EBCS-2-1995.[Sec. 1.2.1 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eClassWork.ClassII
member.summary: Works with a lower level of quality control which are permissible only for single story buildings.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eCompression
member.summary: Contains the provisions given in Chapter 4-Ultimate Limit States of EBCS-2-1995 concerning compression.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation
member.summary: Those sets of physical conditions representing a certain time interval for which the design will demonstrate that relevant limit states are not exceeded. [Section 3.3.1 of EBCS -2, 1995], [Section 1.1.3.2 of EBCS-1, 1995]
member.remarks: See Section 3.3.1 of EBCS-2, 1995 See also Section 1.1.3.2 of EBCS -1, 1995 for definition

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation.Accidental
member.summary: Design situation involving exceptional conditions of the structure or its exposure, e.g. fire, explosion, impact or local failure. [Sec. 1.1.3.2 of EBCS-1, 1995]

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation.PersistentAndTransient
member.summary: Applying both persistent and transient conditions. Persistent means Design situation which is relevant during a period of the same order as the design working life of the structure. Generally it refers to conditions of normal use. [Sec 1.1.3.2 of EBCS -1, 1995]. Transient means Design situation which is relevant during a period much shorter that the design working life of the structure and which as a high probability of occurrence. It refers to temporary conditions of the structure, of use, or exposure, e.g. during construction or repair. [Sec 1.1.3.2 of EBCS-1, 1995].

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eConcreteTestSpecimenType
member.summary: Defines the types of test specimen to test the compressive strength of concrete.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteTestSpecimenType.Cube
member.summary: 200mm sized cubical test specimen

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteTestSpecimenType.Cylinder
member.summary: 150mm diameter and 300mm high cylinderical test specimen

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign
member.summary: Contains the provisions given in Chapter 3, Basis of Design of EBCS-2, 1995

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.ε_c_max_bending
member.summary: Is the maximum compressive strain of concrete in bending(simple or compound) [Sec. 4.2.1.1 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.ε_s_max
member.summary: Is the maximum steel tensile strain.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.ε_c_max_axial
member.summary: Is the maximum compressive strain of concrete in axial compression

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.GetMaterialPartialSafetyFactor(ESADS.Code.eMaterialType,ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Gets the ultimate limit state partial safety factors for the specified material based on the classwork and design situation.[Sec. 3.5.3.1 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The type of material defined in eMaterialType enumeration whose partial safety factor is to be determined.
The design situation defined in eDesignSituation enumeration in which the material is going to be used
The class of work defined in eClassWork enumeration that expresses the quality of work of the design.
member.returns: The ultimate limit state partial safety factor of the selected material.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.GetMaterialPartialSafetyFactor(ESADS.Code.eLimitStateType,ESADS.Code.eMaterialType,ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Gets the partial safety factors for the specified material based on the type of limit state, classwork and design situation.[Sec. 3.5.3 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The type of design to be conducted with the safety factor returned.
The type of material defined in eMaterialType enumeration whose partial safety factor is to be determined.
The design situation defined in eDesignSituation enumeration in which the material is going to be used
The class of work defined in eClassWork enumeration that expresses the quality of work of the design.
member.returns: The partial safety factor of the selected material

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.GetMaterialPartialSafetyFactor(ESADS.Code.eMaterialType,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Gets the partial safety factor for the specified material taking the design situation as Persistent and Transient and the limit state type as Ultimate limit state.
member.param: The type of material defined in eMaterialType enumeration whose partial safety factor is to be determined.
The class of work defined in eClassWork enumeration that expresses the quality of work of the design.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_cd(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade,ESADS.Code.eClassWork,ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation)
member.summary: Gets the compressive strength of concrete based on the class of work according to Sec. 3.5.4.1 if EBCS-2-1995
member.param: The grade of concrete, defined in eConcreteGrade whose design strength is going to be computed.
The class of the work defined in eClassWork enumeration
The design situation, defined in eDesignSituation, in which the concrete is going to be used.
member.returns: The design compressive strength of concrete

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_cd(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Gets the compressive strength of concrete based on the class of work according to Sec. 3.5.4.1 if EBCS-2-1995
member.param: The grade of concrete, defined in eConcreteGrade whose design strength is going to be computed.
The class of the work defined in eClassWork enumeration

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_cd(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade,ESADS.Code.eClassWork,ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation,ESADS.Code.eConcreteTestSpecimenType)
member.summary: Gets the compressive strength of concrete [Sec. 3.5.4 of EBCS -2-1995]
member.param: The grade of concrete, defined in eConcreteGrade whose design strength is going to be computed.
The class of work, defined in eClassWork, in which the concrete is going to be used.
The design situation, defined in eDesignSituation, in which the concrete is going to be used.
The type of concrete test specimen, defined in eConcreteTestSpecimenType, used to test the characterstic strength of the concrete.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_cd(System.Double,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Gets the desing compressive strength for given characterstic compressive strength and class work of the constraction.
member.param: Characterstic compressive strength of the concrete.
Class work of the constraction.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_c(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade,System.Double,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Gets the compressive stress of concrete depending on its grade and the amount of strain. Returns zero if out of limits. It considers cylinderical concrete test specimen with Persistent and Transient design situation. [Fig. 4.2 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The grade of concrete, difined in eConcreteGrade, whose compressive stress is desired.
The amount of compressive strain of concrete expressed in positive number.
The class of work, defined in eClassWork, in which the concrete is going to be used
member.returns: The design compressive strength of concrete as positive value. If the strain is greater than the maximum value specified by the code, is zero or negative(which means the concrete is in tension), zero is returned as there is no compressive stress in all these cases.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_c(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade,System.Double,ESADS.Code.eClassWork,ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation)
member.summary: Gets the compressive stress of concrete depending on its grade and the amount of strain. Returns zero if out of limits. It considers the concrete test specimen as cylinderical. [Fig. 4.2 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The grade of concrete defined in eConcreteGrade, whose stress is to be computed.
The amount of compressive strain of concrete expressed in positive number.
The class of work, defined in eClassWork, in which the concrete is going to be used
The design situation, defined in eDesignSituation, in which the concrete is used.
member.returns: The design compressive strength of concrete as positive value. If the strain is greater than the maximum value specified by the code, is zero or negative(which means the concrete is in tension), zero is returned as there is no compressive stress in all these cases.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_c(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade,System.Double,ESADS.Code.eClassWork,ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation,ESADS.Code.eConcreteTestSpecimenType)
member.summary: Gets the compressive stress of concrete depending on its grade and the amount of strain. Returns zero if out of limits. [Fig. 4.2 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The grade of concrete defined in eConcreteGrade, whose stress is to be computed.
The amount of compressive strain of concrete expressed in positive number.
The class of work, defined in eClassWork, in which the concrete is going to be used
The design situation, defined in eDesignSituation, in which the concrete is used.
The type of concrete test specimen, defined in eConcreteTestSpecimenType, to test the concrete characterstic strength.
member.returns: The design compressive strength of concrete as positive value. If the strain is greater than the maximum value specified by the code, is zero or negative(which means the concrete is in tension), zero is returned as there is no compressive stress in all these cases.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_c(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the compressive stress of concrete depending on its grade and the amount of strain. Returns zero if out of limits.
member.param: The amount of compressive strain of concrete expressed in positive number.
The design compressive strength of concrete whose stress is to be computed.
member.returns: The design compressive strength of concrete as positive value. If the strain is greater than the maximum value specified by the code, is zero or negative(which means the concrete is in tension), zero is returned as there is no compressive stress in all these cases.

The class of work, defined in eClassWork, in which the concrete concerned is found in.

member.summary: Gets the design tensile strength of concrete as per Sec. 3.5.4 of EBCS-2-1995

The class of work, defined in eClassWork, in which the concrete concerned is found in.
The type of concrete test specimen, defined in eConcreteTestSpecimenType, used for determination of the characterstic strength of the concrete
The design situation, defined in eDesignSituation, in which the concrete concerned is found in.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_ctd(System.Double,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Returns the Design tesile strength of a concrete for a given characterstic concrete tensile strength and class work of constraction.
member.param: Characterstic concrete tensile strength.
Class work of the constraction.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_yd(ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)

The class of work, defined in eClassWork, in which the steel concerned is to be used.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_yd(System.Double,ESADS.Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Returns the design yeild strength of a steel reinforcement for a given characterstic yeild strength and classwork.

The class work of the construction.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.GetActionPartialSafetyFactor(ESADS.Code.eActionType,ESADS.Code.eDesignSituation)
member.summary: Gets the limit state partial safety factor for the specified action type [Table 3.3 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The type of action, defined in eActionType, whose partial safety factor is to be determined.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.GetActionPartialSafetyFactor(ESADS.Code.eActionType,ESADS.Code.eActionCondition)

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eServiceability
member.summary: Contains the provision given in Chapter 5-Serviceability Limit States of EBCS-2-1995

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eServiceability.Get_β_a(ESADS.Code.eStructureType,ESADS.Code.eSpanType)
member.summary: Gets the constant given in Table 5.1 of EBCS -2 1995
member.param: The type of structure, defined in eStructureType, under consideration.
The type of span, defined in eSpanType, whose coefficient is to be determined.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eServiceability.GetMinEffDepth(ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade,System.Double,ESADS.Code.eSpanType,ESADS.Code.eStructureType)
member.summary: Gets the minimum depth requirement stated in Sec 5.2.3 of EBCS-2-1995
member.param: The grade of steel to be used
The effective span in meter and for two way slabs it is the shorter span.
Is one of the types of span defined by the eTypeOfSpan enumeration
Is one of the types of structures defined by the eTypeOfStructure enumeration

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eActionType
member.summary: Action is the Force(load) applied to the structure(direct action) or an imposed or constrained deformation or an imposed acceleration[Sec. 1.1.3 of EBCS-1-1995].

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eActionType.Permanent
member.summary: Action which is likely to act throughout a given design situation and for which the variation in magnitude with time is negligible in relation to the mean value, or for which the variation is always in the same direction (monotonic) until the action attains a certain limit value.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eActionType.Variable
member.summary: Action, which is unlikely to act throughout a given design situation or for which the variation in magnitude with time is neither negligible in relation to the mean value nor monotonic.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eShear
member.summary: Contains the provisions given in Chapter 4-Ultimate Limit States of EBCS-2-1995 concerning shear.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eShear.GetVRd(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the ultimate shear capacity of the section to prevent diagonal compresion failure.Refer EBCS-2-1995,section 4.5.2(1).
member.param: The design compresive strength.
The width of the section.
Effective depth of the section.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eShear.GetVc(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the shear force caried by the concrete for section with out significan axial force.Refer EBCS-2-1995,section 4.5.3.1(1).
member.param: The design tensile strength of the concrete.
Width of the section.
Effective depth of the section.
Area of tensile reinforcements.
Value indicating whether the 50% tensile reinforcement is curtailed or not. True if curtailed and false otherwise.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eShear.GetSpacing(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the spacing of vertical shear reinforcements for the given appleid shear.Refer EBCS-2-1995,section 4.5.3.1(1).
member.param: Design yeild strength of the shear reinforcement.
Area of shear reinforcement within a spacing.
Effective depth of the section.
Shear force to be caried by the shear reinforcement.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial
member.summary: Contains provisions given in Chapter 2-Data on concrete and steel of EBCS-2-1995.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_f_ck(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade,ESADS.Code.eConcreteTestSpecimenType)
member.summary: Gets the characterstic cylinder compressive concrete strength [Sec. 2.3 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The grade of concrete, defined in eConcreteGrade, whose characterstic compressive strength is to be computed.
The type of concrete test specimen, defined in eConcreteTestSpecimenType, used to determine the characterstic compressive strength of the concrete.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_f_ck(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade)
member.summary: Gets the characterstic compressive strength of concrete based on the grade and type of test specimen [Sec. 2.3 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The grade of concrete, defined in eConcreteGrade, whose characterstic compressive strength is to be computed.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_f_ctk(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade)
member.summary: Gets the characterstic concrete tensile strength[Sec. 2.4 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The grade of concrete, defined in eConcreteGrade, whose characterstic tensile strength is to be computed.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_f_ctk(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade,ESADS.Code.eConcreteTestSpecimenType)
member.summary: Gets the characterstic concrete tensile strength[Sec. 2.4 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The grade of concrete, defined in eConcreteGrade, whose characterstic tensile strength is to be computed.
The type of concrete test specimen, defined in eConcreteTestSpecimenType, used to determine the characterstic tensile strength of the concrete.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_f_yk(ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade)
member.summary: Gets the characterstic steel strength
member.param: The grade of steel, defined in eSteelGrade, whose characterstic strength is to be determined.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_ConcModOfElasticity(ESADS.Code.eConcreteGrade)
member.summary: Gets the modulus of elasticity of the selected material.
member.param: The grade of concrete, defined in eConcreteGrade, whose modulus of elasticity is to be computed.
member.returns: The modulus of elasticity of concrete

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_ConcUnitWeight(ESADS.Code.eConcreteType)
member.summary: Gets the unit weight of concrete based on its type[Table 2.1 of EBCS-1-1995]
member.param: The type of concrete, defined in eConcreteType, whose unit weight is to be computed.
member.returns: The unit weight of the specified concrete in Kg/mm^3

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.GetSteelUnitWeight
member.summary: Gets the Unit weight of Steel in system units. [Sec. 2.8.1 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.GetSteelModulusOfElasticity
member.summary: Gets the Modulus of elasticity of steel in system units [Sec.2.9.4.1 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.ePunching
member.summary: Contains the provisions given in Chapter 4-Ultimate Limit States of EBCS-2-1995 concerning punching.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.ePunching.GetVrd(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the Ultimate shear resistance capacity of the concrete.
member.param: Perimeter of punching shear.
Design tensile stregth.
Avarage effective depth.
Geometric reinforcment ratio in x-direction.
Geometric reinforcment ratio in y-direction.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eStructureType
member.summary: Defines the type of structure(Organized combination of connected parts designed to provide some measure of rigidity. [Sec. 1.1.3 of EBCS-1-1995])

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eStructureType.Beam
member.summary: A structural component mainly working in bending through the agency of vertical forces and that transmits to the bearing points the loads that are applied to it.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eStructureType.Column
member.summary: A structural component mainly working in axial force and bending and transmits load vertically.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eStructureType.Slab
member.summary: An element generally parallelepipedic of small thickness in comparison with its surface, used as inspection cover, in pavement, cover of box culvert, deck of bridge, etc.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eStructureType.Footing
member.summary: A substructure used to transfer superstructure load from column to the underlying soil.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eConcreteType
member.summary: The classification of concrete based on their physical property like weight, density etc.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteType.LightWeight
member.summary: Concrete with relatively lighter in weight.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteType.NormalWeight
member.summary: Concrete applied for most constructions

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteType.HeavyWeight
member.summary: Concrete with a relatively heavier made with heavier aggregate.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteType.ReinforcedAndPrestressed
member.summary: Concrete used in Reinforced and prestressed construction.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteType.Unhardened
member.summary: Fresh concrete before hardening.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eConcreteType.UserDefined
member.summary: Concrete type defined by user specifying the unit weight.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eLimitStateType
member.summary: Holds the types of limit states

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eLimitStateType.SLS
member.summary: serviceability limit state

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eLimitStateType.ULS
member.summary: ultimate limit state

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade
member.summary: Specifies the available grades of steel based of EBCS

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade.S300
member.summary: Represents the grade of steel with characterstic strength of 300MPa

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade.S400
member.summary: Represents the grade of steel with characterstic strength of 400MPa

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade.S460
member.summary: Represents the grade of steel with characterstic strength of 460MPa

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eSteelGrade.Custom
member.summary: User defined steel grade.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eSpecialStructures
member.summary: Contains provision related to special structures which is specified in EBCS-2 chapter 6.

member.name: M:ESADS.Code.EBCS_1995.eSpecialStructures.GetMinFootingDepth(ESADS.Code.eFootingType)
member.summary: Returns the minimum depth of footing for different footing types.
member.param: The type of footing: whether it is constructed on soil or piles.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement
member.summary: Set of steel rods incorporated into the concrete to ensure its tensile strength. Those available in the code are mentioned here.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ6
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 6mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ8
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 8mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ10
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 10mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ12
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 12mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ14
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 14mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ16
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 16mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ20
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 20mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ24
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 24mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ26
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 26mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ28
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 28mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eReinforcement.Φ32
member.summary: Reinforcemnt bar with 32mm diameter. Its value is its diameter in mm.

member.name: T:ESADS.Code.eExposureType
member.summary: Enumerates the varies Enviromental exposure conditions for Deciding the minimum reinforcement Cover

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eExposureType.Mild
member.summary: Represents Exposures in Dry Enviroment: Interior of a building Normal Habituation office [EBCS _1995 7.1.3 Concrete Cover to Reinforcement,Table 7.2 Minimum Cover Requirements for Concrete Members]

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eExposureType.Moderate
member.summary: Represents Exposures in Humid environment:Interior components (e.g. laundries); exterior components;components in non-aggressive soil and/or in water[EBCS1995 Table 7.2 Minimum Cover Requirements for Concrete Members]

member.name: F:ESADS.Code.eExposureType.Severe
member.summary: Represents Exposures Sever Enviromental Condition[EBCS1995 Table 7.2 Minimum Cover Requirements for Concrete Members]]
